O jogo traz um desafio na medida certa, sem ser muito complexo. Dá uma certa mão aos iniciantes e o começo pode ser um pouco confuso, mas conforme você pega o jeito tudo facilita.
A narrativa é envolvente, porém falta a presença que a sequência teve.
A jogabilidade é fluída e precisa como nos demais jogos da Valve, mecânicas simples de entender e práticas de executar.

This game pulled me out of immersion within the first few minutes. I like to be able to imagine I am the character in a game, in the scenario created, and escape into that world for a while. Half Life 2 failed for me, and Portal made the same errors. In this case: the game begins with you waking up. And you seem to have had radical surgery, with metal bolted onto your bones. Don't you think you would examine that? Check your legs? Is it bolted or strapped on? Could it be removed and you restored to a normal body, or are you permanently disfigured? Does it hurt to walk on it? To fall 50 feet and land on it? The game doesn't answer any of this, meaning I was immediately removed from the character. Either she had information that hadn't been shared with the player (making it difficult to _be_ her in the game), or she somehow doesn't notice or comment upon the fact that she may have been mutilated in her sleep (again, making it impossible to empathise with the character). This could have easily been rectified by a few seconds of close-up, maybe a wince; perhaps later a comment on it, or a sign about the surgery. To gloss over something that would be so major in a person's life is bizarre.

The actual puzzling is generally okay.

One of the best puzzles games ever conceived! I love the characters, the mechanics, and the gameplay. Played through so many times, I have the puzzles memorized. You will not be disappointed if you love puzzles.
Wow, this game is short but powerful... I'll give it a 9/10. It isn't PERFECT but it is certainly good.

Se tem algo que faz eu preferir esse ao invés do Portal 2, é a atmosfera.
Parece que não existe mas nenhum ser existente na terra além de você, e a GLaDOS.
Total isolação e solidão é o que você sente ao andar pelas câmaras de testes da Aperture, com escritórios bagunçados...cientistas que tentaram fugir da neurotoxina, e sabe lá o que GLaDOS fez com os corpos. O que reforça ainda mais a atmosfera de solidão e deixa ainda mais sinistra é a trilha sonora composta por Kelly Bailey, o mesmo que fez a trilha sonora da série Half-Life.  [spoiler]Não me venha com aquela teoria merda do companion cube[/spoiler]
Aqui você mal vê o céu ou a luz do sol, GLaDOS é ainda mais fria do que em Portal 2.

Algo que me assustou na primeira vez, foi ver as mensagens que Doug Rattman deixou na parede, começou a tocar [url=https://youtu.be/aqGXCQ_5WOc]isso aqui[/url]
Realmente, Kelly Bailey é um dos melhores compositores nos jogos, assim como em Half-Life, seu trabalho em Portal também não deve ser esquecido, acredito que Mike Morasky não seria capaz de fazer algo tão atmosférico, já que as músicas dele são mais eletrônicas e alegres.
Recomendo muito Portal, depois de Half-Life é claro.
Não existe palavras q descrevam a fodisse desse jogo, pena q ele é meio curto
Отлично но мне непонравился голос Гладос. Честно говоря 2-ая часть легче.

Um jogo de desafios que em cada fase fica mais complicado, é definitivamente bom para aqueles que gostam de pensar, infelizmente não tem grande dificuldade, assim como eu pensava porem recomendo para aqueles que querem começar do básico, caso queiram algo mais avançado e com MUITA mais dificuldade recomendo o Portal 2.

Enjoy guys!

Portal, un autre classique de Valve. Ici, vous changez totalement des gameplays habituel de Valve. Vous restez dans un gameplay FPS mais il n’est pas question de tuer des zombies, des militaires ou des aliens. Ici, votre seule arme est un créateur de portail. 
C’est grâce à cet outil que vous devrez vous frayer un chemin à travers les 19 chambres de tests d’Aperture Science ! 
Ce jeu de casse-tête vous fera bien cogiter la tête les premières fois, puis, après plusieurs temps de jeux vous voudrez finir le jeu le plus vite possible. 
Les tutoriels étant cachés dans le jeu lui-même vous êtes totalement dans le jeu. Il n’est pas question de texte ou de cinématique pour vous expliquer comment jouer et ce qui se passe. Tous se passe sur le moment !
Et grâce aux nouveautés du moteur Source, la physique sera un point important et les lois de Newton pourront surement vous sauver la vie plusieurs fois !
Hat sich gelohnt

This is a great game, I really enjoyed playing it. Even though the main character is silent, she gives the game a really nice feel, and her "interactions" with GLaDOS are hilarious! It's a puzzle game, but I do not feel stressed out like I do about some puzzle games. It is pretty intiutive, but the challenge puzzles do in-fact pose a challenge for those seeking them. 10/10 would recommend
I'd call this game perfect, if Portal 2 hadn't been even better.

Quirky little puzzle game with a funny ending. Portal mechanics that were unique at the time though now copied or parodied by others many times over.

But essentially this is one of those classic games that every gamer should play through at least once.

The controls aren't perfect, but unless you are trying to 100% the achievements they are good enough to get through the storyline. 

If you haven't played it yet, it's a few hours of fun for a cheap price.

Portal is a classic which IMO everyone should play. In Portal, you solve puzzles using the "Aperature Science Quantum Tunneling Device" (or Portal gun as everyone calls it). The game constantly changes, adding new challenges and gameplay elements and due to how short it is, doesn't outstay its welcome, making it always feel fresh. The game also has one of the greatest stories in gaming. It has a dark humour and an interesting world which everyone should experience for them self. Overall, Portal is a great game and if you've never played it you should probably change that.

Is it even necessary to review this game? Seriously, anyone who has Steam has heard of this game, and anyone who's heard of this game knows it's a classic. If you haven't bought it yet, do so. If you can't buy it right now, buy it as soon as you can.

I had never before played a first person 3D puzzle game.  This game has opened a whole new world of gaming to me.  The idea that puzzles can exist in non-linear 3D fashion is very clever.  The idea that levels are not constrained to what the developer makes is even better.  I enjoy puzzle games but this adds the element of mini-open world to it.  The levels and puzzles are designed with solutions in mind but you can always find your own way.  I feel like achievements were invented for games like this.  I've played through the game a few times just because it's fun to think about how to do the puzzles.

There isn't really much in terms of story, but the writing is clever and entertaining.  There is a story of sorts to unlock as the game progresses but I wouldn't call it story driven.  More like progressive puzzles.  I feel like everyone who enjoys games should play this to see what things first person games can offer other than big guns and action on rails.

The best part of the game is the ability to extend it through the workshop.  There are always new levels whether created by friends, family or yourself.

I would recommend this game to anyone.  Well worth whatever the game is currently selling for.

[h1] The cake is a lie [/h1]

[b]Portal[/b] в своё время была интересна тем, что внесла в привычный движок Source некую новую механику порталов. Сюжет основан на прохождении тестовых камер с использованием двух связанных порталов. Вся игра, однако, проходится часа за полтора-два даже с учётом некоторых затруднений при решении задач. Головоломки тут в основной массе несложные. Для желающих есть дополнительные усложнённые камеры. В остальном, сюжет прост как две копейки. По-своему очаровательная робот-антагонист Глэдос время от времени отпускает шутки в адрес главной героини, но, к сожалению, в русской озвучке не смогли передать полностью её харизму и характер.

Игра почти не успевает оставить какие-либо эмоции после прохождения. Очень уж короткая. Даже писать про неё почти нечего.

7 из 10

this game is absolutely terrible and im trying to install half an hor after playing it

Che dire di Portal... un gran bel gioco.
Gli enigmi non sono per nulla studiati male e alcuni sono piuttosto impegnativi.
Lo stile grafico, personalmente, l'ho trovato davero piacevole, luminoso ed invecchiato bene.
Durante tutta la durata del gioco non si è mai presentato alcun bug, di qualsivoglia genere.
Siccome amo i giochi ad enigmi darei un bel 90 su 100, se non fosse per un piccolo problema.
Esatto, la durata della campagna. Tralasciando le mappe avanzate in aggiunta, la campagna principale risulta davvero corta, come se tutto il gioco fosse un progetto/esperimento. 

Quindi: Portal è assolutamente da giocare, è divertente ed impegnativo. Purtroppo, quando ormai sembra averti preso, è già terminato. Meglio comprarlo in sconto. 

Ah giusto... non c'è traccia di una modalità cooperativa, aggiunta fortunatamente nel secondo capitolo.

Voto finale: 80/100

J'ai à peine joué à ce jeux que je suis sous son charme.Le jeux fonctionne très bien sur mon viel ordinateur portable.On peux sauvegarder notre partie ce qui est formidable.et surtout il est entièrement en français audio incluse!Il y as quand même quelque défault mais ils sont pardonnable.En résumé:

Points Positifs: -Excellent jeux

 Points Négatifs: -Français parfois mal traduite

En somme c'est un jeux que je reccomande chaudement!

Having just beaten the game, I can, without a doubt, say that this is one of the greatest games I have ever purchased. Between puzzles that gently show you the rules, gradually increasing in challenge without ever getting too frustrating, hilarious dry humor from one of the wittiest, snarkiest characters ever put in a video game, and amazing credits music, this is a must-buy for any fan of puzzle games. The only complaint that comes to mind is that it's a bit short, but I enjoyed every second of the 3 and a half hours I spent playing. Now if you'll excuse me, it's on to Portal 2!

I can only recommend that you play this on a console. At some point, they patched the PC version to add hidden radios all over the game after you've beaten the game once & you have to find them for an achievement which is cool but they never go away & you can always hear them everywhere you go, killing the vibe & getting the instrumental version of Still Alive stuck in your head.

Another thing wrong with the PC version is that, when coming out of portals in midair, you often lose all control for a moment even though the game is designed around using midair portal mechanics.

This game is amazing. On 360. Portal 2 is better on PC though & you should totally get that after you beat the 360 version of Portal 1.

What can I say about this that hasn't already been said.   It's a classic with a lot of replayability.  It's very short; only a couple hours on the first play though.  The advanced and challenge maps are ok, though they are all straight from the campaign, so they don't add much to the game as far as diversity.  The challenge maps can be more of a pain mechanically than actually being challenging, especially doing the maps while taking the fewest steps possible.  There are tons of mods to extend your playtime though.  Overall would recommend.

Basically, its worth playing, but Portal 2 is much better in every way.

Моё знакомство с Portal было лишь в 2016 году. Конечно поздно ведь игра 2007 года, но для парня который прошел HL, HL 2 + эпизоды ко 2 части, пройти Portal обязательно нужно! И мне очень и очень понравилось, не знаю как вам, но при прохождение portal я сразу почуствовал движок source, что заставило меня настольгировать по HL 2 (которую я снова с удовольствием пройду).
Сюжет игры "скрыт", только при прохождении становиться более понятно, и что и как, однако после оканчания игры все еще остается масса вопросов, на которые я думаю разработчики ответили во второй части. Также пройдя игру, я не знал предысторию, вследствии чего, я направился на просторы интернета, где получил ответы)))
Минус поставить можно за русскую озвучку GLaDOS!

з.ы.
